GLOSSARY
START BREASTFEEDING AND SKIN-TO-SKIN CONTACT (IF MOTHER AND BABY  
ARE WELL)
Early breastfeeding is good for both babies and mothers. Evidence suggests that early breast-
feeding within one hour of birth helps the baby to establish good bonding with the mother. 
Early breastfeeding may also stimulate uterine contraction for the mother through maternal 
hormone release and help to prevent postpartum vaginal bleeding.24,27,28
